concept.title: Table operations
concept.shortdesc: An overview of some table operations.

section.title: Selecting rows/columns in a table
section.p: Right‐click a cell in the row or column you want to select. Then choose Select and then choose one of the possibilities:

section.title: Inserting a table row/column
section.p: Right-click a cell, choose Insert and then one of the options:
When you select a cell in the last row or last column, you also have the options
At the last cell, at the bottom right, you have both possibilities.
Fast way to add a new row: Select the bottom-right cell and press the Tab key.

section.title: Deleting a table row/column
section.p: Right-click a cell in the row/column you want to delete, choose Delete and then one of the options:

section.title: Convert table to a range
section.p: Select a cell inside the table. Choose tab Design (Table Tools) Convert to Range (group Tools) and confirm the operation.

section.title: Apply a table style
section.p: Select a cell inside the table. Choose tab Design. Select a style from the Table Styles gallery.

section.title: Adding Total Row
section.p: Select a cell inside the table. Choose tab Design Check Total Row (group Table Style Options) .

Excel automatically inserts a row named Total at the bottom of the table and adds a SUBTOTAL function below the last column. Select in the Total row the cell for the column you want to total, then select an option from the drop-down list.

section.title: Table Name
section.p: When a table is created, then automatically a name is supplied tot the table. The generated names look like Table1, Table2, … When the table is selected, you see the name at tab Design Table Name (group Properties) . To change the name you can type the new name in the name box.
Using appropriate names for tables can be important because when you add formulas to an table, the names of tables columns automatically appears in the formulas. For example: =SUM(Table1[@Column3])
